intro: Mesembryanthemum matutinum, commonly known as the morning glory of the mesembs, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its leaves and stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that open in the morning and close by midday, adapting to hot and arid environments. Its fleshy, often hairy leaves help reduce water loss, and it thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
